articles.author: Ethan Siegel
articles.title: The “atom” lost its original meaning, and that’s good for science - Big Think
articles.description: Invented over 2000 years ago by Democritus, the word atom literally means uncuttable. Revived in 1803, today's "atoms" can indeed be split.

articles.title: Unusual Crater in The North Sea Result of a Cosmic Collision, Study Confirms - ScienceAlert
articles.description: Sometime in the Middle Eocene epoch, nearly 50 million years ago, a large object hurtled through Earth's atmosphere, crashing into the North Sea between what's now Britain and northwestern Europe.
